Candidate :  Gnouni Yengoian  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   USA 
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
 Masters in Civil Engineering – Structural, California Polytechnic University, Pomona 2016  
• Thesis – “Seismic Performance A ssessment of Oil Refinery Base Connections via Non -Linear 
Finite Element Analysis”  
• Course work: Reinforced Concrete Design / Plate and Shell Structures / Advanced Steel 
Structures / Structural Dynamics  
 
Bachelors in Civil Engineering – Geospatial, California Polytechnic University, Pomona 2013  
• Presiden t of California Land Surveyors Association. Civil Engineering Honor Society student 
member.  
 
Languages  
Russian  (Fluent )  
English (Fluent)  
Armenian  (Fluent)  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2017 – 2021 PJSC Cryogenmas h 
One of the largest suppliers of cryogenic equipment.  More than 600 air separation and gasification 
plants built in 30 countries in 70 years; fuels above 30% of spaceports worldwide.  
 
Position: program Manager of Process Engineering / Deputy Manager of En gineering Ins titute 
 
Project manager experience :  
• Led a successful hybrid project to restructure the engineering institute with 12 departments and 
more than 230 specialists.  
• Managed engineering deliverables for more than 15 domestic and international projects in 
excess of 750 million USD for Air Separation  Plants and unique cryogenic equipment 
(turboexpanders, vacuum chambers, heat exchangers, valves, ejectors)  
  
Managerial experience :  
• Collaborated with sales, PMO, engineering, manufacturing and quality to understand and reform 
business processes.  
 • Develop ed 5-year operation optimization plans in correspondence with expected market growth 
and expansion into new markets.  
• Developed procedures and organized work for improved control of multiple parallel projects.  
 
Commercial bidding experience :  
• Established new bid development strategy / Performed project feasibility studies.  
• Prepared more than 170 technical and commercial bids for international clients (UK / China / 
India / Italy / Russia).  
 
Procurement experience :  
• Develop ed new procurement strategy an d procedures to optimize speed, increase quality and 
minimize risk.  
• Selected vendors for more than 200 million USD worth of equipment and services.  
 
Engineering experience :  
• Led enginee ring teams in structural failure analysis of pressure vessels, dynami c equipment, 
and support structures.  
• Led emergency design modifications to critical manufactured and procured equipment in lieu of 
quality and contractual issues.  
• Led development of  new processes, technologies and manufacturing of new equipment, and 
engineering upgrades  
 
Position: Project Manager of UZGTL ASU  
 
Project manager experience :  
• Project manager for the largest EP contract in the history of the company (196 million USD).  
• Improved communication and the relationship with the customer, the owner, the upper 
management, and the suppliers and held weekly communications to resolve engineering and 
procurement issues.  
• Stabilized the project from critical state and improved key per formance indicators (SPI, CPI, 
EAC).  
• Secured a contract increase of $29,0 00,000 in change requests and got proper project 
financing.  
• Created the key project procedures / schedule control for all suppliers and inter -company 
departments.  
• Developed c ritical path and project catch -up plans.  
 
Managerial experience :  
• Established t he project teams to control and streamline work within the departments for the 
project.  
• Collaborated with the top Air Products project m anagement team and incorporated western 
management control systems.  
• Developed project teams; distributed responsibilit ies and leadership roles.  
• Developed a lessons learned register to identify and catalog knowledge gained during the 
project execution .  
  
 Procurement experience :  
• Vendor r eview and selection / risk analysis and contract negotiations for equipment in excess  of 
120 million USD.  
• Contract amendment of the 20 million USD Siemens mega -compressor; negotiations for a 3 -
sided novation.  
• Established expediting teams to manage cr itical equipment to minimize risk from subcontracted 
work.  
 
2010 – 2017 Curtiss -Wright N uclear Division  - Enertech  
Provides a range of products and services for the global nuclear power industry, nuclear power plants, 
NSSS suppliers, A&E’s, OEMs, and the U.S. Department of En ergy.  
Position: Engine ering Lead / Anal ysis Eng ineer / Proje ct Engin eer 
• Work emphasis on component design, analysis, research and development. Worked on large 
international projects, supplying Class 1 Safety -Related components to nuclear power plants 
across U.S., Canada, China, Korea , and other European and Asian countries .  
• Engineering lead for developing unique engineering solutions for nuclear power plants. 
Successful completion of a 2 -year R&D project of the largest electro -hydraulic actuator 
assembly (10 -ton gate valve actuator ).  
• Fatigue, seismic, and stress analysis based on ASME Section III, ANSI, AISC, IEEE standards.  
• Expert Knowledge of ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Section III, Crane Technical Paper 410, 
“Flow of Fluids through Valves, Fittings, and Pipe” / Roark & Yo ung, “Roark’s Formulas for 
Stress and Strain” / “Machinery’s Handbook” / Shigley’s “Mechanical Engineering Design.” 
Familiarity with civil and military standards IBC, CBSC, and MIL -HDBK -881A.  
• Developed a butterfly valve actuator -sizing tool. Analyzed ov er 200 valve configurations using 
flow FEA simul ation, correlated with in -field testing. Automated calculations for a compressible 
and incompressible flow parameter, based on EPRI NP -7501.  
Created detailed designs of pumps, valves and electro -hydraulic actuators. Developed assembly and 
machining drawin gs, based on ASME Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing standards.  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Software mastery:  
• SolidWorks Mo deling and Analysis Package / SAP2000 v17.1 / ANSYS 17 Mechanical & 
Multiphysics / Mathcad / Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoi nt, Access, Publisher, 
Projects) with Visual Basic Programming / Autodesk CAD Products / MicroStations with Inroads 
/ Tableau Professional statistical analysis  
• Capable use of SmartPlant 3D / Oracle Primavera P6 / Microsoft Power BI  
 
For further informati on please contact Julie Smith  or Jan Johnston on 01695 5 70 6 96 or email 
julie.smith @johnston -vere.co.uk
